publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4068 Karen Whitefield: 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award—That the Parliament congratulates the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award in its 50th anniversary year; recognises the contribution made by the organisations that operate the award and the exceptional number of hours of volunteering undertaken by leaders in supporting over 20,000 young people each year in Scotland; further recognises the efforts of participants in the volunteering section of the award and its wider benefits to communities across Scotland and across the world; acknowledges the contribution the award makes to promoting a healthy lifestyle to young people; recognises the benefits in terms of skills development, enterprise, teamwork and personal and social development; acknowledges the findings of recent research which indicated the tremendous value placed by employers on the award programme, and looks forward to welcoming the International Forum and UK General Council to Edinburgh in November 2006.
S2M-4068 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award (lodged on 7 March 2006) Michael Matheson*, Derek Brownlee*
S2M-4068 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award (lodged on 7 March 2006) Mr David Davidson*

S2M-4068 Karen Whitefield: 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award—That the Parliament congratulates the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award in its 50th anniversary year; recognises the contribution made by the organisations that operate the award and the exceptional number of hours of volunteering undertaken by leaders in supporting over 20,000 young people each year in Scotland; further recognises the efforts of participants in the volunteering section of the award and its wider benefits to communities across Scotland and across the world; acknowledges the contribution the award makes to promoting a healthy lifestyle to young people; recognises the benefits in terms of skills development, enterprise, teamwork and personal and social development; acknowledges the findings of recent research which indicated the tremendous value placed by employers on the award programme, and looks forward to welcoming the International Forum and UK General Council to Edinburgh in November 2006. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Derek Brownlee, Mr David Davidson
S2M-4068 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award (lodged on 7 March 2006) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-4068 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award (lodged on 7 March 2006) Christine May*, Maureen Macmillan*, Jackie Baillie*, Kate Maclean*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Patrick Harvie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mike Pringle*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Murdo Fraser*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Des McNulty*, John Farquhar Munro*, Margaret Jamieson*, Trish Godman*, Euan Robson*, Robin Harper*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Sarah Boyack*, Mary Scanlon*, Scott Barrie*, Cathy Peattie*, Michael McMahon*, Bristow Muldoon*

S2M-4068 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award (lodged on 7 March 2006) Nora Radcliffe*, John Scott*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Eleanor Scott*, Chris Ballance*, Susan Deacon*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Phil Gallie*
S2M-4068 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award (lodged on 7 March 2006) Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-4068 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award (lodged on 7 March 2006) Janis Hughes*, Cathie Craigie*
S2M-4068 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award (lodged on 7 March 2006) Shiona Baird*

S2M-4068# Karen Whitefield: 50th Anniversary of the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award—That the Parliament congratulates the Duke of Edinburgh’s Award in its 50th anniversary year; recognises the contribution made by the organisations that operate the award and the exceptional number of hours of volunteering undertaken by leaders in supporting over 20,000 young people each year in Scotland; further recognises the efforts of participants in the volunteering section of the award and its wider benefits to communities across Scotland and across the world; acknowledges the contribution the award makes to promoting a healthy lifestyle to young people; recognises the benefits in terms of skills development, enterprise, teamwork and personal and social development; acknowledges the findings of recent research which indicated the tremendous value placed by employers on the award programme, and looks forward to welcoming the International Forum and UK General Council to Edinburgh in November 2006. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Derek Brownlee, Mr David Davidson, Donald Gorrie, Christine May, Maureen Macmillan, Jackie Baillie, Kate Maclean, Patrick Harvie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr Frank McAveety, Mike Pringle, Mr Brian Monteith, Murdo Fraser, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Des McNulty, John Farquhar Munro, Margaret Jamieson, Trish Godman, Euan Robson, Robin Harper, Dr Elaine Murray, Marilyn Livingstone, Mrs Nanette Milne, Sarah Boyack, Mary Scanlon, Scott Barrie, Cathy Peattie, Michael McMahon, Bristow Muldoon, Nora Radcliffe, John Scott, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Eleanor Scott, Chris Ballance, Susan Deacon, Pauline McNeill, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Jim Wallace, Phil Gallie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Janis Hughes, Cathie Craigie, Shiona Baird Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
